name: In
description: The Indices DAT creates a series of numbers in a table, ranging between the start and end values.  These values are suitable for display along a graph horizontal or vertical axis.  They are carefully picked to make them all round, nicely spaced, etc.
summary: The Indices DAT creates a series of numbers in a table, ranging between the start and end values.  These values are suitable for display along a graph horizontal or vertical axis.  They are carefully

parameters.name: Start
parameters.label: Start
parameters.description:
From Derivative
		
		
		
		
		Jump to navigation
		Jump to search
		
The Indices  creates a series of numbers in a table, ranging between the start and end values.  These values are suitable for display along a graph horizontal or vertical axis.  They are carefully picked to make them all round, nicely spaced, etc.
indicesDAT_Class

Contents
 
 
 
 




  start - The start of the number range.


	
  end - The end of the number range.


	
  level - Determines how the range is divided. Coarse = 0, Medium = 1, Fine = 2.


	
  origin - The first number in the series.





  language -  - Select how the  decides which script language to operate on.

 input - The  uses the inputs script language. node - The  uses it's own script language.

  extension -  - Select the file extension this  should expose to external editors.

 dat - various common file extensions. language - pick extension from DATs script language. custom - Specify a custom extension.

  customext - Specifiy the custom extension.



  wordwrap -  - Enable Word Wrap for Node Display.

 input - The  uses the inputs setting. on - Turn on Word Wrap. off - Turn off Word Wrap.



 -TouchDesigner Build: Latest\n2021.100002018.28070before 2018.28070
DATs
• • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • 

An Operator Family that manipulates text strings: multi-line text or tables. Multi-line text is often a python Script or GLSL Shader, but can be any multi-line text. Tables are rows and columns of cells, each containing a text string.



The generic thing that holds an Operator, and includes Flags (display, bypass, lock, render, immune) and its position/size in the network. Whether you "lay down an Operator" or "lay down an Node", you're doing the same thing.








Retrieved from "https://docs.derivative.ca/index.php?title=Indices_DAT&oldid=14136"
		Category: DATs
